intro: Acinodendron caryophyllaeum, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy fruits that contain seeds enclosed in a fibrous aril. Its bark and wood have been historically valued for their aromatic properties and use in traditional medicine. Due to overharvesting, it is now classified as an endangered species in its natural habitat.
